content.content: A new update is now live for the Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard! As always, if you have any comments or feedback, we would love to hear from you! The dashboard can be found at mkrgov.science   New Screenshots  image1016×461 27.8 KB   image1315×267 12 KB   image1268×696 31.2 KB   New in this version!  Voting History  Search voters See voter’s participation on Exec votes and Polls   Help text for each metric, Example queries on TheGraph explorer Fixed MKR Responsiveness for exec votes and polls Partial automation for processing new exec votes Performance improvements Other smaller bug fixes and improvements   Once again thank yous to the following:   Protofire for continuing to work on this dashboard. Without them, this would not exist. The Maker Foundation for providing the funds for this development through the Grants Program   @rich.brown for initiating this project.   Repositories + Zenhub    GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-dashboard: MakerDAO Governance Dashboard MakerDAO Governance Dashboard. Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-dashboard development by creating an account on GitHub.         GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-subgraph Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-subgraph development by creating an account on GitHub.         ZenHub    ZenHub Project Management and Software Development with GitHub | ZenHub       Other Notes  If you identify an issue or you have a suggestion for the dashboard, you can either comment here, or post it as an issue here: Issues · protofire/maker-governance-dashboard · GitHub  You’ll need a github account in order to view the zenhub. Protofire use this internally and have agreed to open it for access in the spirit of community engagement, please don’t make their lives difficult. The url mkrgov.science is currently owned by protofire on behalf of the Maker Foundation on behalf of MakerDAO. If anyone is wondering why I’m making this announcement, it’s because I’ve been acting as stakeholder in the project for the last few weeks. I am planning to continue in this role for V2. The governance community is welcome to have as much of a say into this project as it wants in this project going forward. Make your thoughts known in this thread, I’m happy to discuss or pass them along to whomever is appropriate.
Nice, but page load times are ridiculous. Recently https://daistats.com/ has improved page load times a lot. Can some similar caching get implemented for the gov analytics?

Yep, I agree completely. V3 is planned to be a polish and bugfix release, so hopefully we’ll get to resolve a lot of those sorts of issues. If anyone has feedback for the next version, there is a good chance I can get it implemented if it’s easy to implement, so don’t hold back.
It looks great, but I agree with @psychonaut that speed is the biggest opportunity to improve

Over the past few months, some of you may have noticed the ad in the ‘Help Wanted’ section of the forum regarding a Maker Governance Dashboard. Some of you maybe even have taken note when the status changed from ‘wanted’ to ‘taken.’ Well, without further ado, I’m happy to introduce v1 of mkrgov.science: the communities new governance analytics dashboard! Ever wondered how much MKR is distributed across the various executive proposals? How the amount of MKR has varied within DS-Chief? The results of that specific poll that happened you-can’t-remember-when? All these questions answered at mkrgov.science!  image1109×786 48.6 KB   On a serious note, a huge thank you to:   Protofire for creating this dashboard. I have found them to be very professional and easy to work with. The Maker Foundation for providing the funds for this development through the Grants Program   @rich.brown for initiating and stake-holding much of this project.    Version 2 and Beyond This is the first version of the governance analytics dashboard. Feedback is very much desired from any and all members of the community. If there is a metric you would like to see included, or if you have comments or suggestions regarding UX or layout, please share these in the comments below. Protofire have been engaged to work on version 2, which will include numerous improvements and extensions to the current functionality. V2 should be complete in Q1 2020. Community feedback will be addressed with in v2 or v3 of this dashboard (depending on the extent of the feedback.)   Further notes  Repositories + Zenhub    GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-dashboard: MakerDAO Governance Dashboard MakerDAO Governance Dashboard. Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-dashboard development by creating an account on GitHub.         GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-subgraph Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-subgraph development by creating an account on GitHub.         ZenHub    ZenHub Project Management and Software Development with GitHub | ZenHub      Other Notes  If you identify an issue or you have a suggestion for the dashboard, you can either comment here, or post it as an issue here: Issues · protofire/maker-governance-dashboard · GitHub  You’ll need a github account in order to view the zenhub. Protofire use this internally and have agreed to open it for access in the spirit of community engagement, please don’t make their lives difficult. The url mkrgov.science is currently owned by protofire on behalf of the Maker Foundation on behalf of MakerDAO. If anyone is wondering why I’m making this announcement, it’s because I’ve been acting as stakeholder in the project for the last few weeks. I am planning to continue in this role for V2. The governance community is welcome to have as much of a say into this project as it wants in this project going forward. Make your thoughts known in this thread, I’m happy to discuss or pass them along to whomever is appropriate.

This is really nice @LongForWisdom I’ve been wanting to see how the votes over time look for the various exec votes for ages and now I can  so thanks for working on this with Protofire. One thing I would love to see on the list of Executive Votes (https://mkrgov.science/executive) is a little marker that signifies which one is the hat, it’s always a slightly confusing thing in our own governance UI where we just show the most recent proposal and adjust it to show the hats contract. Great job though, already looking forward to the future improvements in V2!

Thanks for the kind words      ChrisB:  One thing I would love to see on the list of Executive Votes (https://mkrgov.science/executive) is a little marker that signifies which one is the hat   Hmm, I think I’d prefer to see it as a separate status. Also having a status for ‘currently active’ (since the current hat maybe not be the last cast spell.) That would give us Statuses of: Open, Passed, Hat, and Active. Active is a somewhat misleading term given the nature of the system though. And we’d need Active + Hat… On second thought perhaps an icon would maker more sense… Hat Icon + ‘Active’ as a status for the last cast spell?
What if the hat is not (on?) an executive on the first page (10 rows by default). What do you click to find it?
Eh, i guess you just sort by mkr. Yeah, my ‘vote’ would be to have an icon.
Hello Leo/Protofire, Under the “Polls” tab, can you please include a field for the Number of Unique Voters? Thank you in advance.

As a quick note to everyone, the dashboard is not currently picking up the latest executive. (It uses a different contract as it is changing two parameters rather than one. This caused unforeseen problems.) I will be working on coordinating a fix next week.

First post here. Can we actually have units on the vertical bar side of the graphs.   It may be obvious to everyone else that the MKR voted is on the right and the users on the left but I get tired of people using graphs without units labeled on various axes.    Also do we really call this ‘users’ vs. ‘wallets’? Any way to have a download .csv available on the data.   It also would be nice to have links to definitions or explanations of terms.    I still have to fish out what the definition of the gini coefficient is. Right now that is the total of my comments on the dashboard at this point.

@MakerMan Great Idea!!! It could be like the Microsoft Q&A on the Learning page. I will not post a link to there since they are our competitor, haha but having a vote option on the side bar could be really good and easier to vote for everyone

discourse_list.title: Governance Initiative: Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard

content.content: Due to ongoing development costs, and unrelated workload on myself and Rich Brown, this initiative has ended. What is happening? @LongForWisdom is acting as stakeholder and project manager for the creation and continued work on mkrgov.science. Why is it happening? @rich.brown identified the need for a governance analytics dashboard and has paid Protofire to create it out of the Maker Foundation Community Grants fund. Rich has many responsibilities, so he has delegated management to @LongForWisdom Who is involved? @rich.brown @LongForWisdom are both involved on the MakerDAO side. Protofire have been engaged to do development work on this project. When should we expect results? Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard v2.1 - Last update for the foreseeable future. Previously These have been delayed by the whole Covid Crash thing. I will update once we have a date for resuming work on this.  The development has slowed down over the last few weeks after the launch of version 2. Going forward, the project is moving to a two-week release cycle, the aim is to produce iterative polish and functionality changes more rapidly going forwards. These two-week cycles should begin in March.

There are so many suggestions I have in some of my notes regarding changes I’d like to see in the governance dashboard. Should we put these here or in some other thread? Where can we see the list of things being worked on or see the ‘vision’ for the Maker governance future being worked on now?

MakerMan:  Should we put these here or in some other thread?   This thread seems like a reasonable place to gather such feedback.     MakerMan:  Where can we see the list of things being worked on or see the ‘vision’ for the Maker governance future being worked on now?   I am hoping that this thread: Governance Initiatives will be what you describe, but it requires others that are active in the ecosystem writing up and being transparent about what is going on. I can encourage this, and attempt to make it easier for people to do so, but I can’t force people into it.

@LongForWisdom is this project open source? I’d like to contribute but can’t find the source repo. I’ve noticed that  Versions are leaked in response headers The page polls for data a lot and the responses aren’t cached Initial page load times are high Source maps are shipped increasing bundle sizes. Not needed if it’s open source Missing Content-Security-Policy etc…  I understand that the project is a work-in-progress and a community effort so I think the best thing I could do is start to address some of these points myself. They are all fairly straight forward and I think they would contribute to the site being faster and more secure  Stoked to see it’s written in Typescript!

I did already talk about the security mention on Github, missing informations etc, but looks like this is not a important point nor something that would need to discuss about. Providing an open-source project without any security attach to it, sure.     dawson:  I understand that the project is a work-in-progress   Yes but still…

Sirlupinwatson1:  I did already talk about the security mention on Github, missing informations etc, but looks like this is not a important point nor something that would need to discuss about. Providing an open-source project without any security attach to it, sure.   I think the risk is that any interface endorsed by the Maker organization is a target for manipulating and misinforming the crowd which could hurt the Maker ecosystem as whole. What the Protofire team build is really great, and I’m sure they’re working on a lot more. I don’t want to be a whiner I’ll just try to help @Sirlupinwatson1 where on Github were you discussing the interface? A link in the right direction would be awesome

dawson:  @Sirlupinwatson1 where on Github were you discussing the interface? A link in the right direction would be awesome   I did Fork the repository MCD Security on my own repository, Up to you to have a look. It might be usefull yes. I can see bram00767 is involved, but that all.
Thanks @Sirlupinwatson1, I’ll take a look through MCD Security and try to understand how I can contribute. I was also able to find the mkrgov.science source repo here.

@dawson Yes , you might find some that you can make some add on , like a security parameter, or a Security.md etc in the repo. Honestly i did not work on this, i was mostly waiting on a reply to put some add on. Feel free to do it. You can have a look here with the documentation also : MakerDAO Docs

Hey @dawson! Super excited that you want to contribute to this! I see you found the repo, which is awesome. Some of your points I was aware of, but some I definitely was not, so thanks very much for the feedback. Are you present on the official chat? If so, please hit me up (@LongForWisdom) and I can introduce you to the Protofire group and you guys can coordinate. There are several related posts in the forum under the mkrgov-science tag. Feel free to browse these, they have links to repositories, task boards, etc.

A new update is now live for the Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard! The dashboard can be found at mkrgov.science.  Screenshots   image1277×764 40.7 KB   image1302×764 24.9 KB    New in this version!  Dashboard  Metrics reorganised into categories. New metrics  Top voters Most voted polls Uncast executives MKR Activeness (30 Day Average) Staked MKR Percentage MKR Responsiveness (polls and votes)    Poll Details  Split graph “Voters vs MKR Voter Per Option” Poll details list shows more relevant data. Show/Hide Data Series and Rescale options graphs. New metrics  Top voters    Executive Vote Details  Split graph “Number of Voters vs. Total MKR Staked” Executive Vote details list shows more relevant data. Address navigation (link to etherscan and clipboard icons) New metric: ‘VS current hat’  Poll/Executive Lists  Added vertical separators to Executive Votes and Poll Lists  And probably some other things that have been forgotten.  Once again thank yous to the following:   Protofire  for continuing to work on this dashboard. Without them, this would not exist. The Maker Foundation for providing the funds for this development through the Grants Program    @rich.brown for initiating this project. Protofire use this internally and have agreed to open it for access in the spirit of community engagement, please don’t make their lives difficult. The url mkrgov.science is currently owned by protofire on behalf of the Maker Foundation on behalf of MakerDAO. If anyone is wondering why I’m making this announcement, it’s because I’ve been acting as stakeholder in the project for the last few weeks. I am planning to continue in this role for V2. The governance community is welcome to have as much of a say into this project as it wants in this project going forward. Make your thoughts known in this thread, I’m happy to discuss or pass them along to whomever is appropriate.
content.GPT-summary: The post announces a new update for the Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard, providing details on the new features and metrics added. The author also thanks the contributors and invites feedback and suggestions from the governance community.

3rd party or author is advertising proposal

content.content: So as a short note, some of the new metrics are slightly opaque in what they are actually showing and why they are useful. There will be help-text and explanations of these in the next version.

Author of proposal is asking for feedback

content.content: Can we have labels for known addresses like a16z etc. to see how they voted? I guess it’s no secret.

discourse_list.title: Governance Initiative: Maker Business Analytics Dashboard

content.content: What is happening? @hexonaut is building a business analytics dashboard for the Maker protocol via his company Bellwood Studios. This website will provide time-series data on all relevant Maker stats broken-down by collateral / vault type. Why is it happening? @hexonaut identified the need for a business analytics dashboard to answer governance questions beyond peg stability. Who is involved? @rich.brown is involved on the MakerDAO side. @hexonaut is the project lead for development. When should we expect results? An initial version should be ready for early/mid-May 2020 with a more feature complete version ready for mid-June. I will update the time estimates as progress is made. GitHub: GitHub - BellwoodStudios/maker-business-analytics-website: Business analytics website for the Maker protocol. Preview: https://www.mkranalytics.com/

After testing a few different dashboards, I have found the most useful information for Collateral / Vault Type is found in Makerburn in this link. What other KPIs are you envisioning for these enhanced dashboards?
Not sure why this was bumped from 2 years ago. Code is open source, but I cannot maintain anymore. It still works I think.

A new update is now live for the Maker Governance Analytics Dashboard! As always, if you have any comments or feedback, we would love to hear from you! The dashboard can be found at mkrgov.science   New in this version!  The poll list now lets you navigate past the first page of data. Executive Metadata is now visible for older executive votes. Changed MKR Participation number format on the poll list such that it shows a reasonable number of decimal places. You can now link to individual metrics if you want to share them with others. Significantly reduced load time for most pages. No longer show invalid data while polls are loading.   Thank you to the following:   Protofire for their work on this dashboard. The Maker Foundation for providing the funds for this development through the Grants Program   @rich.brown for initiating this project.    Repositories    GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-dashboard: MakerDAO Governance Dashboard MakerDAO Governance Dashboard. Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-dashboard development by creating an account on GitHub.         GitHub    GitHub - protofire/maker-governance-subgraph Contribute to protofire/maker-governance-subgraph development by creating an account on GitHub.        Future Work Unfortunately, work on this dashboard has been halted indefinitely on the following grounds:  Ongoing cost of development. Higher than expected workload for myself and Rich over the next few months due to the introduction of MIPs, collateral onboarding and the governance cycle.
